Events that occurred on 5 May.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - Edith Tolkien writes her first letter to her husband at Thirtle Bridge army camp, near Withernsea from her new lodgings in Hornsea. The letter was re-directed to Hornsea Musketry Camp.
1944 - Actor John Rhys-Davies is born.
1947 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 107a.
1958 - Author James Branch Cabell dies.
1960 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 222f.
1977 - J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography is first published in the UK.
2009 - The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrún is published.
2010 - The America's Next Top Model episode "Hobbits vs. Models" premières on The CW.
2011 - English and Medieval Studies Presented to J.R.R. Tolkien on the Occasion of his Seventieth Birthday is made available as a print-on-demand publication from HarperCollins.
2024 -Actor Bernard Hill, who portrayed Theoden in The Lord of the Rings (film series), dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content: There are no known events for this day.
